addPermissionToRoles(String, RoleEntity) - Method in class com.example.springsecurityproject.service.PermissionService
This method will add a permission to a role e.g. permission:write - ROLE_ADMIN e.g permission:read - ROLE_MODERATOR
addRole(String) - Method in class com.example.springsecurityproject.service.RoleService
This method will add a role, without setting any permission (to set the permission read PermissionService.java) e.g.
addRoleToUser(RoleEntity, UserEntity) - Method in class com.example.springsecurityproject.service.UserPermissionService
This method will add a specified role to a specified user.
addToken(String, UserEntity) - Method in class com.example.springsecurityproject.service.TokenService
This method will add the "token" (Secret key) for a specified user.
addUser(UserEntity) - Method in class com.example.springsecurityproject.service.UserService
This method when invoked will save into the Database a new user, with an encrypted password (PasswordConfig.java for more info)
ApplicationSecurityConfig - Class in com.example.springsecurityproject.security
This class is going to set the configuration for the security

attemptAuthentication(HttpServletRequest, HttpServletResponse) - Method in class com.example.springsecurityproject.jwt.JwtUsernameAndPasswordAuthenticationFilter
This method is executed - as the name says - when a client is trying to log-in via /login It'll return an Authentication based if the user exists, if it doesn't exist, nothing will happen.
